channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Treasury yields becalmed as traders await Fed decision
item.description: Bond yields were little change early Tuesday as investors kept their powder dry ahead of the Federal Reserve‚Äôs policy decision on Wednesday.

item.title: Merck beats earnings expectations, raises sales outlook on strong demand for top drugs like Keytruda
item.description: The drugmaker raised its full-year sales forecast to $63.4 billion to $64.4 billion on increased demand for key products, particularly oncology treatments.

item.title: Air New Zealand becomes first major airline to scrap its 2030 climate goal
item.description: Air New Zealand on Tuesday dropped its 2030 climate goal, citing delivery delays of fuel-efficient aircraft and the affordability of alternative jet fuels.

item.title: Who might be the Democratic vice-presidential nominee? Here‚Äôs what betting markets say.
item.description: The news that North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper has opted out of the race to be Kamala Harris‚Äôs running mate has shifted the betting markets.

item.title: Why the U.S. elects so many older politicians
item.description: The United States has been described as a gerontocracy by academics due to the advanced age of many lawmakers, in sharp contrast to the younger electorate.

item.title: Merck beats earnings expectations, raises sales outlook on strong demand for top drugs like Keytruda
item.description: The drugmaker raised its full-year sales forecast to $63.4 billion to $64.4 billion on increased demand for key products, particularly oncology treatments.

item.title: JetBlue Airways stock rises after it posts surprise profit
item.description: Stock gains more than 3% in premarket trades.

item.title: 'White Dudes for Harris' raise $3.5 million for Democrat's campaign against Trump
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris is eyeing a number of Democratic men as possible running mates for the election race against former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Stock futures are slightly higher ahead of key corporate earnings: Live updates
item.description: Investors awaited numerous key earnings releases and the beginning of the Federal Reserve's policy meeting.

item.title: Why the stock market is now in a ‚Äòshow-me phase‚Äô as soft landing ‚Äònot fully assured‚Äô
item.description: The stock market is approaching a ‚Äúshow-me moment‚Äù as prospects for a soft landing for the U.S. economy are ‚Äúnot fully assured,‚Äù says Morgan Stanley Wealth Management‚Äôs CIO.

item.title: Delta hires David Boies to seek damages from CrowdStrike, Microsoft after outage
item.description: Delta has hired prominent attorney David Boies to pursue potential damages from CrowdStrike and Microsoft after a mass outage earlier this month.

item.title: Euro zone's economy grew 0.3% in second quarter, above expectations despite German contraction
item.description: The euro zone's economy grew by more than expected in the second quarter of 2024, flash figures from the European Union's statistics office showed Tuesday.

item.title: Traders are focused on a central bank this week. But it may not be the Fed.
item.description: Three of the world‚Äôs most significant central banks this week will deliver monetary policy updates in the space of about 32 hours.

item.title: Trump's FBI victim interview on assassination attempt will be Thursday, he says
item.description: The FBI wants Trump's "perspective" on the attack, in which a shooter fired at the Republican nominee while he was on stage in Pennsylvania.

item.title: Johnnie Walker-maker Diageo plunges 10% on full-year sales decline, but Guinness a bright spot
item.description: Shares of spirits giant Diageo tumbled on Tuesday morning, after the Johnnie Walker-maker posted its first sales decline since the start of the pandemic.
